Container.Name: Swords n Magic and Stuff
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Swords 'n' Magic and Stuff and run it.
**ATTENTION:** First startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files and it also installs the runtimes which can take quite some time!
**First Start Notice:** On First startup the container installs the necessary runtimes and it might seem that the container hangs but please be patient since the installation can take very long on some systems (5 minutes+).
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.

Config.Name: GAME_ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container download at startup. (https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

Config.Name: Server Name
Config.Description: Enter the name for your server (must be 2-5 of the allowed words found in Saved/Logs/AllowedWords.txt).

Config.Name: Server Owner Steam ID
Config.Description: Enter your Steam ID for ownership of the server.

Config.Name: Server Password
Config.Description: Enter the password for your server.

Config.Name: Server Max Players
Config.Description: Enter the max amount of players for your server.

Config.Name: Validate Installation
Config.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

Config.Name: UDP1 - GamePort
Config.Description: UDP GamePort (If you need another port delete this entry and create a new UDP port mapping here in the template with the Container and Host port set. You will also need to update the ports in Saved/Config/WindowsServer/Engine.ini).

Config.Name: UDP2 - SteamPort
Config.Description: UDP SteamPort (If you need another port delete this entry and create a new UDP port mapping here in the template with the Container and Host port set. You will also need to update the ports in Saved/Config/WindowsServer/Engine.ini).

Config.Name: Steam-Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Steam-Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).
